tasks.title: Keyboard Test
tasks.instructions: Connect a USB keyboard and press any key to know more about your keyboard

tasks.title: Tap and swipe
tasks.instructions: You will be shown 2 words. Tap when you see the word tap. Swipe when you see the word swipe.

tasks.title: Multiplication Tables - 2
tasks.instructions: You will be shown the numbers 1 to 12. Tap if it is divisible by 2, else swipe.

tasks.title: Multiplication Tables - 3
tasks.instructions: You will be shown the numbers 1 to 12. Tap if it is divisible by 3, else swipe.

tasks.title: Multiplication Tables - 5
tasks.instructions: You will be shown the numbers 1 to 12. Tap if it is divisible by 5, else swipe.

content.expectedAnswerExplanation: Number does not end in 0 or 5
Number does not end in 0 or 5
Number does not end in 0 or 5
Number does not end in 0 or 5
Number does not end in 0 or 5
Number does not end in 0 or 5
Number does not end in 0 or 5
Number does not end in 0 or 5
Number does not end in 0 or 5
Number does not end in 0 or 5

tasks.title: Months of the year
tasks.instructions: Tap the screen to hear the word. Then try to spell it. Once you have finished spelling the word, press enter. Complete all 12 words to finish the exercise. Ensure your audio is not on mute for this activity.

tasks.title: Countries in Asia
tasks.instructions: Tap the screen to hear the word. Then try to spell it. Once you have finished spelling the word, press enter. Complete all words to finish the exercise. Ensure your audio is not on mute for this activity.

tasks.title: Parts of the human body
tasks.instructions: Tap the screen to hear the word. Then try to spell it. Once you have finished spelling the word, press enter. Complete all words to finish the exercise. Ensure your audio is not on mute for this activity.

tasks.title: Major cities in the world
tasks.instructions: Tap the screen to hear the word. Then try to spell it. Once you have finished spelling the word, press enter. Complete all words to finish the exercise. Ensure your audio is not on mute for this activity.

tasks.title: small letters
tasks.instructions: You will be shown some letters. Type as many as you can correctly within the time limit.

tasks.title: capital letters
tasks.instructions: You will be shown some capital letters. Type as many as you can correctly within the time limit.

tasks.title: numbers game: single digits
tasks.instructions: You will be shown some numbers. Type them out using your keyboard.

tasks.title: Positive Numbers: Greater than and less than
tasks.instructions: You will be shown some statements. Tap if it is true. Swipe if it is false.

tasks.title: Negative Numbers: Greater than and less than
tasks.instructions: You will be shown some statements. Tap if it is true. Swipe if it is false.

tasks.title: addition/subtraction 1
tasks.instructions: You will be shown some statements. Tap if the result is equal to 0. Else swipe.

tasks.title: addition/subtraction 2
tasks.instructions: You will be shown some statements. Tap if the result is greater than 0. Else swipe.

tasks.title: planets - in order
tasks.instructions: You will be shown the names of planets, in order of how far they are from the Sun. Type them out as quickly as you can.

tasks.title: planets - not in order
tasks.instructions: You will be shown the names of planets, in random order. Type them out as quickly as you can.

tasks.title: clock face 180
tasks.instructions: You will be shown some times. Tap if the time forms a 180 degree angle on a clock face. Otherwise swipe.

tasks.title: clock face 0
tasks.instructions: You will be shown some times. Tap if the time forms a 0 degree angle on a clock face. Otherwise swipe.

tasks.title: months of the year
tasks.instructions: You will be shown the months of the year. Tap if the spelling is correct. Swipe if the spelling is incorrect.

tasks.title: division 1
tasks.instructions: You will be shown some statements. Tap if the result is greater than 1. Else swipe.

tasks.title: Prime Numbers
tasks.instructions: You will be shown some numbers between 2 and 50. Tap if it is a prime number. Swipe if it is not a prime number.

tasks.title: Months of the year
tasks.instructions: You will be shown the months of the year in the right order. Try to type them out correctly.

tasks.title: Months of the year
tasks.instructions: You will be shown the months of the year in the right order. Type them out as quickly as you can.

tasks.title: Months of the year
tasks.instructions: You will be shown the months of the year in random order. Type as many as you can in 1 minute.

tasks.title: vowels
tasks.instructions: You will be shown some letters. Tap if it is a vowel. Swipe if it is not a vowel.

tasks.title: Practice Keyboard Home Row
tasks.instructions: You will be shown the keys of the keyboard home row. Type them as fast as you can and see how many you got right.

tasks.title: Practice Keyboard Top Row
tasks.instructions: You will be shown the keys of the keyboard top row. Type them as fast as you can and see how many you got right.

tasks.title: Practice Keyboard Bottom Row
tasks.instructions: You will be shown the keys of the keyboard bottom row. Type them as fast as you can and see how many you got right.

tasks.title: Months of the year
tasks.instructions: You will be shown 12 sentences about months of the year. Type them out correctly. When you have finished all 12, we will show how many characters you got right.

tasks.title: Singular pronouns
tasks.instructions: These pronouns are singular and take singular verbs. Type them out correctly.

tasks.title: Subject-Verb Agreement: is/are
tasks.instructions: You will be shown some sentences. Tap if the subject-verb agreement is correct. Else swipe.

tap.question: Earth is a planet
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is Earth, which is singular. Therefore verb should be 'is', which is singular.

tap.question: The cars are parked in the garage
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is cars, which is plural. Therefore verb should be 'are', which is plural.

tap.question: The fact that it rained so much today is bad.
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is 'The fact', which is singular. Therefore verb should be 'is', which is singular.

tap.question: Skies are clear.
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is 'skies', which is plural. Therefore verb should be 'are', which is plural.

tap.question: John and Tom are going to school.
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: There are 2 subjects: 'John' and 'Tom'. This is plural. Therefore verb should be 'are', which is plural.

tap.question: The computers are for sale.
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is 'computers', which is plural. Therefore verb should be 'are', which is plural.

tap.question: Tom's family is moving.
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is 'family', which is singular. Therefore verb should be 'is', which is singular.

tap.question: People are waiting for the leader to arrive.
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is 'people', which is plural. Therefore verb should be 'are', which is plural.

tap.question: Airplanes are fast
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is 'airplanes', which is plural. Therefore verb should be 'are', which is plural.

tap.question: Cows are grazing in the field.
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is 'cows', which is plural. Therefore verb should be 'are', which is plural.

swipe.question: Earth are a planet
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is Earth, which is singular. Therefore verb should be 'is', which is singular.

swipe.question: The car are parked in the garage
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is car, which is singular. Therefore verb should be 'is', which is singular.

swipe.question: The cars is parked in the garage
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is 'cars', which is plural. Therefore verb should be 'are', which is plural.

swipe.question: The fact that it rained so much today are bad.
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is 'The fact', which is singular. Therefore verb should be 'is', which is singular.

swipe.question: John and Tom is going to school.
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: There are 2 subjects: 'John' and 'Tom'. This is plural. Therefore verb should be 'are', which is plural.

swipe.question: The computers is for sale.
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is 'computers', which is plural. Therefore verb should be 'are', which is plural.

swipe.question: Tom are moving.
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is 'Tom', which is singular. Therefore verb should be 'is', which is singular.

swipe.question: People is waiting for the leader to arrive.
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is 'people', which is plural. Therefore verb should be 'are', which is plural.

swipe.question: Airplanes is fast.
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is 'airplanes', which is plural. Therefore verb should be 'are', which is plural.

swipe.question: Cows is grazing in the field.
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is 'cows', which is plural. Therefore verb should be 'are', which is plural.

tasks.title: Periodic table group 1
tasks.instructions: You will be shown the elements of group 1. Try to type them out correctly.

tasks.title: Periodic table group 2
tasks.instructions: You will be shown the elements of group 2. Try to type them out correctly.

tasks.title: Periodic table halogens
tasks.instructions: You will be shown the halogens. Try to type them out correctly.

tasks.title: Periodic table noble gasses
tasks.instructions: You will be shown the list of noble gasses. Try to type them out correctly.

tasks.title: Independent Clauses
tasks.instructions: An independent clause is a sentence that contains a subject and a verb. You will be shown some sentences. Tap if the sentence is an independent clause. Otherwise swipe.

tap.question: John likes football.
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is John, verb is likes. This is an independent clause.

tap.question: Fish like the water.
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is fish, verb is like. This is an independent clause.

tap.question: Airplanes go fast.
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is airplanes, verb is go. This is an independent clause.

tap.question: He sang a song.
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is he, verb is sang. This is an independent clause.

tap.question: They played games.
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is they, verb is played. This is an independent clause.

tap.question: He threw the ball
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is he, verb is threw. This is an independent clause.

tap.question: They went to the park.
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is they, verb is went. This is an independent clause.

tap.question: He can go home.
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is he, verb is can. This is an independent clause.

tap.question: She travelled by car.
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is she, verb is travelled. This is an independent clause.

tap.question: Clouds appeared in the sky.
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is clouds, verb is appeared. This is an independent clause.

swipe.question: He a song.
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is he. There is no verb. This is not an independent clause.

swipe.question: Sang a song.
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: Verb is Sang. There is no subject. This is not an independent clause.

swipe.question: Fish water.
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is fish. There is no verb. This is not an independent clause.

swipe.question: Like water.
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: Verb is Like. There is no subject. This is not an independent clause.

swipe.question: Airplanes fast.
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is airplanes. There is no verb. This is not an independent clause.

swipe.question: John football.
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is John. There is no verb. This is not an independent clause.

swipe.question: Likes football.
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: Verb is likes. There is no subject. This is not an independent clause.

swipe.question: They the park.
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is they. There is no verb. This is not an independent clause.

swipe.question: Went to the park.
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: Verb is went. There is no subject. This is not an independent clause.

swipe.question: He the ball.
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: Subject is he. There is no verb. This is not an independent clause.

tasks.title: Present Tense
tasks.instructions: You will be shown some sentences. Tap if it is written in present tense. Else swipe.

tap.question: John has a car.
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: The verb here is has, which is the present tense of 'to have'. Therefore this is in the present tense.

tap.question: He drinks a glass of milk.
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: The verb here is drinks, which is the present tense of 'to drink'. Therefore this is in the present tense.

tap.question: She plays the violin.
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: The verb here is plays, which is the present tense of 'to play'. Therefore this is in the present tense.

tap.question: He enjoys football.
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: The verb here is enjoys, which is the present tense of 'to enjoy'. Therefore this is in the present tense.

tap.question: He takes the bus in the morning.
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: The verb here is takes, which is the present tense of 'to take'. Therefore this is in the present tense.

tap.question: She looks at the blue sky.
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: The verb here is looks, which is the present tense of 'to look'. Therefore this is in the present tense.

tap.question: He goes to office everyday.
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: The verb here is goes, which is the present tense of 'to go'. Therefore this is in the present tense.

tap.question: The flight arrives in the city now.
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: The verb here is arrives, which is the present tense of 'to arrive'. Therefore this is in the present tense.

tap.question: The machine washes the clothes.
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: The verb here is washes, which is the present tense of 'to wash'. Therefore this is in the present tense.

tap.question: She does her homework every evening.
tap.expectedAnswerExplanation: The verb here is does, which is the present tense of 'to do'. Therefore this is in the present tense.

swipe.question: John had a car.
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: The verb here is had, which is the past tense of 'to have'. Therefore this is NOT in the present tense.

swipe.question: He will drink a glass of milk.
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: The verb here is will drink, which is the future tense of 'to drink'. Therefore this is NOT in the present tense.

swipe.question: He drank a glass a water.
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: The verb here is drank, which is the past tense of 'to drink'. Therefore this is NOT in the present tense.

swipe.question: She played the violin.
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: The verb here is played, which is the present tense of 'to play'. Therefore this is in the present tense.

swipe.question: She will play the violin tomorrow.
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: The verb here is will play, which is the future tense of 'to play'. Therefore this is NOT in the present tense.

swipe.question: He will take the bus in the morning.
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: The verb here is will take, which is the future tense of 'to take'. Therefore this is NOT in the present tense.

swipe.question: He will go to office everyday.
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: The verb here is will go, which is the future tense of 'to go'. Therefore this is NOT in the present tense.

swipe.question: The flight arrived in the city yesterday.
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: The verb here is arrived, which is the past tense of 'to arrive'. Therefore this is NOT in the present tense.

swipe.question: The flight will arrive in the city tomorrow.
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: The verb here is will arrive, which is the future tense of 'to arrive'. Therefore this is NOT in the present tense.

swipe.question: She did her homework last night.
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: The verb here is did, which is the past tense of 'to do'. Therefore this is NOT in the present tense.

swipe.question: She will do her homework tomorrow morning.
swipe.expectedAnswerExplanation: The verb here is will do, which is the future tense of 'to do'. Therefore this is NOT in the present tense.

tasks.title: Autism story
tasks.instructions: You will be shown a story. Swipe to go through the cards

courses.title: Learn Keyboard Middle Row
courses.description: Middle row is located at the center of the keyboard, third row from the bottom. We will now practice typing with the middle row.

tasks.title: Type f and press spacebar
tasks.instructions: Type f and press spacebar. Do this 4 times. Target accuracy 75%.
